docs.lead_paragraph: MUNICH. WHEN children play with toys anything serves a purpose; a clothespin becomes the Queen of Spain or a bit of wood the Leviathan. Toys for grownups apparently must ape in miniature the life about grown-ups and the game is skillful workmanship rather than any fun in the toy after it is made.

headline.main: TOYS IN GERMAN MUSEUMS DEPICT LIFE OF THE PEOPLE; Some of Them Are Complete Villages, the Work of Peasants Who Took Pride in Their Craftsmanship -- Simple and Elaborate Creches

docs.abstract: Art on toys in Germanic Museum in Nuremburg
docs.snippet: MUNICH. WHEN children play with toys anything serves a purpose; a clothespin becomes the Queen of Spain or a bit of wood the Leviathan. Toys for grownups apparently must ape in miniature the life about grown-ups and the game is skillful workmanship...
